ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep, they work *much* better with an instrument now. ... From: CMai  To:  Sent: Friday, April 07, 2000 11:07 AM Subject:
ygData.messageBody:
Yep, they work *much* better with an instrument now.

----- Original Message -----
From: "CMai" <cmai@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, April 07, 2000 11:07 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks


> so are you saying that the chant series are fix now even with instrument?
> Because it used to be that it does not matter if you use an instrument or
> not.
>
> Thank you,
> Syren Wynd - The Bard of Bad Apple - The Rathe
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2000 4:59 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks
>
>
> Ok, I did a quickie chart to list all of our damage songs and fill in some
> numbers:
>
> http://www.sba.uwm.edu/jgs/Sylly/songdmg.asp
>
> (this chart presumes you are using an instrument)
>
> I would say that the best 3 song mix at level 50 is: SCC(48), TCF(38 or
46 -
> either one if they do the same dmg & of course the one that is resisted
> less) & DDD(18). Ugh swapping 3 different instruments. This would make
me
> choose the best songs for a 2 instrument swap that would have the best
> chances of sticking.
>
> Also, looking at the chart, bards dont get the opportunity to weave 3
> stacked songs until level 30 and then FCC(30) is likely resisted because
of
> the low difference in level between mob and song. So more like 32 or 33
> before you get good results from weaving 3 stacked dmg songs.
>
> Sylly
>
>
>
>
